technology.name: Isha, the Mother
technology.description: Isha is mother to all. The legends of Athel Loren tell that Asuryan forbade her from involving herself in the lives of her mortal children. Heart broken by this decree, she chose to take mortal form along with her consort, the God of the Hunt, Kurnous. Together they became Ariel and Orion, and Athel Loren was transformed into a realm divinely blessed.

effects.description: Income from Grape Vine buildings: +5%
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Life spells
Casualty replenishment rate: +5% for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units

technology.name: Mathlann, Lord of the Deeps
technology.description: As Lord of the Deeps, Mathlann is venerated by sailors and those that travel the deep blue sea. However, he is an uncaring deity, just as likely to curse his followers as he is to grant them safe passage. He is also known as King of Storm and Sea and has been known to send many a loyal Elf to their death. Worship at your peril!

effects.description: Immune to Storm and Reef attrition
Income from Ports: +100%

technology.name: Estreath, Lord of Hunger
technology.description: Estreath is one of the few Ellinilli to have survived the wrath of their father. When word reached him that Ellinill had been tricked by Loec and intended to devour his children, Estreath fled to the mortal world. There he remains to this day, refusing to return to the heavens for fear of his father's retribution.

effects.description: Enemy siege holdout time: -4 (minimum 1 turn)
Upkeep: -10% for all Elf units

technology.name: Loec, the Trickster
technology.description: Loec the Trickster is beloved of Wardancers and all those who tell the history of Athel Loren through song and dance. He is a benevolent deity who gifts his followers with cat-like grace; all he asks in return is unswerving loyalty and ritual war dances. However, Loec's love does not end when an Elf leaves the mortal realm. He has even been known to steal souls from Slaanesh, using his cunning and intellect to win their freedom from an eternity of torment.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for all Elf units
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Shadows spells

technology.name: Ladrielle, Lady of Mists
technology.description: The Lady of the Mists is the patron of those who travel the wilderness and protector of all that is lost or hidden. There are many Elves in Athel Loren who chose to live in the wilderness rather than suffer the dull life of a courtier. Waywatchers and Waystalkers feel the call of the forest coursing through their veins and find, from an early age, that they are more at home in the wild places of the Deepwood than in the halls of their kin.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +20 with Bretonnia
Campaign movement range: +5%
Evasion chance when using the Worldroots: +20%

technology.name: Hoeth, Lord of Wisdom
technology.description: Hoeth is the Lord of Wisdom and it is said that he shared the wisdom of the gods with the first Elves. Asuryan was enraged by his actions and as a punishment set Hoeth's great library ablaze. He is the deity of choice for those seeking greater understanding, those who wish to know more of the world and their place in it.

effects.description: [HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
Lord recruit rank: +2
Hero recruit rank: +2

technology.name: Kurnous, the Hunter
technology.description: As the God of the Hunt, Kurnous embodies much of what it means to be Asrai and as such is held in high esteem by all the Elves of Athel Loren. In his mortal form, as the god-king Orion, his life is tied to the seasons. Born anew each Spring, he walks willingly into his funeral pyre come Midwinter. This is not before he has led his people on the Wild Hunt, a call of the wild that sees even the most civilised of the Asrai abandon themselves to their primal urges for its duration, allowing peaceful coexistence for the rest of the year.

effects.description: Income from Hunting buildings: +10%
Weapon strength: +10% for Elf cavalry, Hawk and Eagle units
Charge bonus: +15% for Elf cavalry, Hawk and Eagle units

technology.name: Asuryan, the Creator
technology.description: Though Asuryan enjoys the title 'Creator', and is considered the highest of the Elven pantheon by the High Elves, he is just another deity to the Wood Elves of Athel Loren. In the Pantheonic Mandela of the Asrai he is banished to the outer circle, while Kurnous and Isha take pride of place at the centre.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +15 with High Elves
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of High Magic spells
Construction cost: -15% for all buildings

technology.name: Vaul, the Maker
technology.description: The battles that raged between the gods in millennia past had many casualties, and Vaul was chief amongst them. Wounded by Khaine, Vaul is both blind and crippled, but this does nothing to lessen his skill. He is the God of the Forge and patron to all those who work an anvil. He toils endlessly, creating weapons of great power to pass on to the Elves, for he has seen their doom and knows they will need all the help they can get.

effects.description: Income from Resource and Crafting buildings: +10%
Armour: +10 for Elf infantry and cavalry units

technology.name: Wisdom of the Wildwood
technology.description: If you go down to the woods today, you might come back... changed.

effects.description: Physical resistance: +20% for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks and Giant Wolves units
Passive Spite Ability: Murder of Spites for Malevolent Treeman units

technology.name: Lileath, the Maiden
technology.description: Like many of her fellows, Lileath seldom involves herself directly in the affairs of the Elves, choosing instead to send messages through the medium of dream. This Goddess of the Moon and patron of seers, scholars and mages is said to be able to see the true intent of one's heart. She does not judge based on what an Elf does, but on what he intends to do.

effects.description: Winds of Magic starting amount: +10 for all armies
Hero capacity: +2 for Spellsingers

technology.name: Cadai
technology.description: The Elven Pantheon is split into two distinct groups, the Cadai and the Cytharai. The Cadai are the gods of the heavens and are openly worshipped by all the Asrai. The Cytharai, on the other hand, are the gods of the Underworld, or Mirai, and are often appeased rather than worshipped. As the Elves of Athel Loren are free to worship as they choose, their are those who take the Cytharai to heart; rumours say that the warriors of the Pine Crags have forsaken Kurnous for his vengeful counterpart, Anaeth Raema.

effects.description: Forest Health: +1 per turn to all owned Magical Forests
Diplomatic relations: +15 with High Elves
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for Lore of Life and Lore of High Magic

technology.name: Wisdom of the Pine
technology.description: Pine is plentiful and has many practical uses.

effects.description: Upkeep: -15% for all Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units
Construction time: -25% for all buildings

technology.name: Wisdom of the Poplar
technology.description: The poplar grows fast and strong.

effects.description: Growth: +25
Recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units (minimum 1)

technology.name: Wisdom of the Oak
technology.description: The oak is stalwart and sturdy.

effects.description: Income from Settlement buildings: +10%
Attribute: Expert Charge Defence for Eternal Guard units

technology.name: Morai-Heg, the Crone
technology.description: Morai Heg is the Weaver of Prophecy and Keeper of Souls - she knows and sees everything and is responsible for laying out the secrets of the future in the stars. Each and every Elven death is foretold by her. The archers of Athel Loren have a deep respect for Morai Heg; no Elven archer would shoot down a raven as they are her chosen messengers.

effects.description: Campaign line of sight: +25% for all settlements and characters
Public order: +1

technology.name: Wisdom of the Eagle Lords
technology.description: The Great Eagles of Athel Loren carry news of distant events.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +25 for Great Eagle units
Physical resistance: 10% for Great Eagle units
Provides line of sight over all Magical Forest regions
Beware: this will make distant foes aware of you!

technology.name: Wisdom of the Willow
technology.description: The willow protects with its sheltering boughs, and knows ways of healing.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units
Casualty replenishment rate: +5% when in foreign territory

technology.name: Wisdom of the Ancients
technology.description: Older than the forest itself, the Ancients of Athel Loren are to be revered and feared. Sadly, many of them have passed into memory and those that survive to this day are not the gentle forest spirits of old, but vengeful guardians bent on protecting their home no matter the cost. When an Ancient dies, their essence is absorbed back into the forest and all their wisdom passes on to their fellows. Only two remain, possessed of the knowledge and pain of all their fallen brethren.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for Lore of Beasts spells
Bound spell: "Flock of Doom" for all Ancient Treeman Lords

ui_effects.description: ➕ Strong vs 120 men unit or above

technology.name: Khaine, the Bloody-Handed God
technology.description: Khaine is the Bloody-handed God of Murder. Where the High Elves keep their worship of him to a level that maintains his favour without completely surrendering themselves to him, the Dark Elves give body, mind and soul to Khaine. Wood Elves however, choose their deity according to their own natures. All Wood Elves hold Kurnous and Isha above all others, but are just as happy to embrace the wildness of Khaine as they are to embody the compassion of Lileath.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for all units
Ability: "Heroic Killing Blow" for all Glade Lords and Glade Captains
Attribute: Causes Fear for all Elf units

technology.name: Wisdom of the Ash
technology.description: The ash knows many secrets, and provides sturdy and plentiful arrows.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +35%
	(all armies)
Diplomatic relations: +10 with all factions

technology.name: Wisdom of the Yew
technology.description: The yew's branches are supple, but its berries deadly.

effects.description: Ability: Yewberry Infusion for Dryads, Tree Kin and Treeman units

Reload time reduction: +15%
	(all armies)

technology.name: Wisdom of the Cypress
technology.description: The cypress is flexible, and remains standing when flame sweeps all else aside.

effects.description: Gain +5 additional Forest Health for razing Heathlands
Fire resistance: 25% for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units
Vigour loss reduction: -25% for melee infantry units

technology.name: Ellinill, Lord of Destruction
technology.description: The Lord of Destruction has a complicated past and an even more complicated relationship with his children. Legend tells that he had over a hundred offspring, known as the Ellinilli, and together they brought untold destruction to the Elves. Isha pleaded with the other gods to stop the path of destruction, but her pleas fell on deaf ears - deaf except for Loec, who saw an opportunity to use his fabled wit against Ellinill. Convincing him that his children were plotting a coup, Ellinill devoured them all.

effects.description: Gain +1 additional Forest Health for winning battles in Magical Forests or their Heathlands
Income from razing settlements: +10%

technology.name: Wisdom of Addaivoch
technology.description: The Tree of Woe is a symbol of Elf-kind's manifold failures.

effects.description: Attribute: Stalk for Giant Wolves and Giant Spider units
Passive ability: "Deathblow" for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units

technology.name: Ereth Khial, the Pale Queen
technology.description: Also known as the Pale Queen, Ereth Khial is the Supreme Goddess of the Underworld. Unhappy with her place in the Elven Pantheon, she spent most of her time plotting ways to topple Asuryan from his throne. However, she has bigger things to worry about now, namely Slaanesh. The army of Elven souls she was attempting to build is somewhat diminished of late, as the Dark Prince claims many of the choicest specimens for himself.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +10%

Untainted: +4
	(factionwide)

technology.name: Cytharai
technology.description: The Elven Pantheon is split into two distinct groups, the Cadai and the Cytharai. The Cadai are the Gods of the Heavens and are openly worshipped by all the Asrai. The Cytharai, on the other hand, are the Gods of the Underworld, or Mirai, and are often appeased rather than worshipped. As the Elves of Athel Loren are free to worship as they choose, their are those who take the Cytharai to heart; rumours say that the warriors of the Pine Crags have forsaken Kurnous for his vengeful counterpart, Anaeth Raema.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +15 with Dark Elves
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for Lore of Shadows and Lore of Dark Magic
Global recruitment duration: -1 turn for all units

technology.name: Anath Raema, the Savage Huntress
technology.description: This vengeful goddess is known as the Savage Huntress. Where Kurnous teaches his followers that to take from the forest without giving back is wrong, Anath Raema encourages it. It is said that she once had feelings for Kurnous but he spurned her affections and it was rejection that turned her heart to vengeance. Though her worship is frowned upon in the high courts of Athel Loren, there are whispers that the warriors of the Pine Crags have chosen her over Kurnous.

effects.description: Bonus vs Large: +5 for all Elf cavalry, Hawk Rider and Great Eagle units
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Beasts spells
Missile strength: +10% for all missile units

technology.name: Drakira, Queen of Vengeance
technology.description: The Queen of Vengeance, Drakira, is ever ready to help an Elf seeking retribution for some slight or other. She choses to spend her time away from the other gods and as such is the favoured goddess of the Waystalkers, who prefer to spend their time deep in the forest. Though Drakira is quick to grant her gifts, they seldom come without a price and she is just as quick to claim that in payment.

effects.description: Enemy units are afflicted with temporary defensive penalties at the beginning of ambush battles
Ambush success chance: +20%

technology.name: Eldrazor, Lord of Blades
technology.description: As the patron of duellists, Eldrazor is venerated by those who fight for honour. This makes him particularly popular with the Eternal Guard, who are often called upon to fight trials by combat in the name of their Lord. To fight in the Arena of Blades is the highest honour an Eternal Guard can hope to achieve. Not only because it is a mortal extension of Eldrazor's Arena of Death, but also because by sacrificing his life he could save thousands of others.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 10% for Elf infantry units
Melee attack: +5 for all Elf infantry units

technology.name: Addaioth, Bringer of Fire
technology.description: Addaioth is known as the Bringer of Wrath and Fire, and is one of the few Ellinilli to survive the trick played on their father by the Trickster God, Loec. Unlike his siblings, who fled and hid from their father, he met him in battle and the two fought for three days and three nights. However, Addaioth was no match for his father. Luckily for him, Ladrielle saw his predicament and blinded Ellinill, spiriting Addaioth away to the mortal realm.

effects.description: Fire resistance: 25% for all Elf units
Weapon strength: +15% for Forest Dragons (units and mounts)

technology.name: Hekarti, Mistress of Magic
technology.description: Hekarti is a goddess of magic, but unlike Lileath she represents its darker side. A capricious deity, she pays close attention to the Elves' wants and desires, whereas other gods chose to avoid contact with them. As a result, she often finds herself in direct competition with her sister Atharti, the Goddess of Desire.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +20
Cooldown: -10% to Lore of Dark Magic spells

technology.name: Hukon, the Sunderer
technology.description: The Sunderer is the Elven God of Earthquakes and one of the five Ellinilli to survive the wrath of his father by fleeing to the mortal world. Like all good fathers, Ellinill held a deep-seated distrust for his children. Although their power emanated from him, Ellinill worried that should they unite they would have the power to overthrow him. It  was this distrust that Loec used to put an end to the Ellinilli's reign of terror.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +15 for Zoats, Treemen and Forest Dragon units

Speed: +5%
	(all armies)

technology.name: Nethu, Keeper of the Last Door
technology.description: Nethu is the gatekeeper of the Underworld and son to Ereth Khial. He is tasked with ensuring that the few souls claimed by his mother before they could be devoured by Slaanesh remain trapped until Rhana Dhandra, and that no living soul breaks into the realm of the dead to steal its secrets.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance: +15%
Leadership: +5 for all Elf units
Income from post-battle loot: +10%

technology.name: Atharti, Lady of Desire
technology.description: This Elven goddess has the power to turn mortal men into bowing supplicants, she is a master seductress and can see the deepest desires of any Elf's heart. This makes her a dangerous deity to follow - she encourages her followers to completely give themselves over to their desires at the cost of all else. She is also the sister of Hekarti and the two have a fierce rivalry.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Dark Elves
Global recruitment capacity: +2
